ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I received experience in academic research in physics.
How to conduct physics research, scientific writing and presentation skills
Physics research in atmospheric physics
Necessary skills for performing research.
Knowledge about research
I further pursued my Physics 471 research in this course.

In this class, I had the opportunity to do lab work and contribute to a greater physics collaboration. I actively learned how to participate and collaborate in the lab, and I was able to further investigate a specific, interesting topic in physics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is a really well done course.
Good pacing of the course and deliverables
Na

Most of the work is done with your own research group. I think this class is well formulated to support you in your research with a few updates throughout the semester. The final presentation and paper is a good way to summarize all you have done and practice key research skills.
Wonderful class
The course itself is very nice because it lets you focus on your research project.

The strength of this course is that students can pursue research freely with a professor on a project of their choice. However, the greatest weakness of this course is the lack of feedback given on the deliverables, including a proposal, midterm report, presentation, and final report.

This course was great because it provided a good way for me participate in active research and gain a better understanding of the current questions in physics. However, I think it would have been helpful to find ways to check in with the other researchers in the class and see what kind of research they were doing. I really enjoyed the student project sessions, and I wish I had the opportunity to engage with other student projects throughout the entire semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to another student who is considering grad school or wants research experience.
Yes, for physics research requirement
Yes
Yes, if you need to take it for the major.
Every physics major has to take this course to graduate, but I would recommend research for everyone.
Yes. Physics research is one of the most engaging, interesting parts of the physics major, and this class is a way to participate in research for a credit in the major.
